titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1076_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1076_01

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

tʾlb b-stkmln kl ṭyb w-ṣrf tnṭʿw w-hqšbn l-mwṯb

1.ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ [and Yar-] 2.im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, [Lord of Tur- 3.ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them 4.through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested(?) and planted for the shrine

tei:div.tei:text: <ab type="formal-markup"><lb n="1"/>ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ <supplied reason="lost">and Yar-</supplied> <lb n="2"/>im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, <supplied reason="lost">Lord of Tur- <lb n="3"/>ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them <lb n="4"/>through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested<unclear>?</unclear> and planted for the shrine</ab>

div.tei:ab:
ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ and Yar-
im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tur-
ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them
through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested? and planted for the shrine

ʿAlhān Nahfān and his son Shāʿirum ʾAwtar, King of Sabaʾ and Yar-
im ʾAyman, King of Sabaʾ, have offered to their patron-god Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Tur-
ʿat, three statues of bronze out of gratitude because Taʾlab favored them
through granting all of the ṭyb-incense and ṣrf-incense which they had requested? and planted for the shrine
